title: Which emoji best represents 'graphic design?' - Quora

response.answer_text: Emoji or icon? emoji :  Icon:  There is a difference—One conveys an emotion the other is a symbol that represents something. they aren’t really the same thing, though technically, an emoji would be an icon that represents an emotion. It is used within a typed conversation in order to convey the intent of the written word where normal voice inflection and body language are absent…. …asking what emoji best represents “graphic design” is like asking “…which toothbrush best represents higher mathematics?” Yeah, they really don’t have a lot in common there…  …now icons, that’s a different story, but you asked about emoji’s and I’m afraid you’re not going to find many that represent graphic design, most are simply the traditional smiley face guy, with different emotions and body language gestures represented, but… …as far as icons go, I’ve always liked this guy here:
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Mohammad Akter Hossain

response.answer_text: Playoff’s Graphic Design Intern will be responsible for product design for the unique digital stickers, emoji, themes and content we create. The packs are designed based on licensing partners, large mobile app partners we will work with to deliver great digital content on mobile, and advertising opportunities with brands around the world.
